intro: Commersonia reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate commersonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Commersonia reticulata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
